title: Exploring Trends and Design Practices in Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning (CSCL)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of collaborative learning concepts and constructivist theory
context.additional_context: Focuses on developing collaborative learning models applicable to real classrooms by experiencing various CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) scenarios in VR environments, utilizing simulation tools on personal devices in BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) settings

learning_goals: Learners can classify the nine core themes of CSCL research and explain the educational significance of each
Learners can design collaborative learning scenarios in VR simulation environments based on socioconstructivist learning approaches
Learners can create CSCL activity plans incorporating peer feedback through project-based assessments

resources: VR-Based CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) Simulation Platform

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
